p: It has been suggested that seed size has an influence on its composition. Kingwell [ 16] points out that most of the protein in lupine seeds resides in the inner part and, because the seed coat constitutes a greater proportion in small seeds, large seeds tend to have more protein. Thus, it is likely that under the conditions where the crop was developed (Jalisco region), the seeds used in our study did not grow well enough and its protein content was reduced.
